comments.text:
Okay so, JB decides he wants to confess to the girl and threatens her that 
he'll jump off if she doesn't accept. Well, considering how far away she is 
and how she was blasting music through half of his confession, she 
"rejects" him purely 'cause she can't hear him. His future self appears 
after she leaves and JB thinks he's hallucinating because he clearly is 
lol, so he ends up falling off the roof into a parallel universe. There he 
finds out that the girl is super friendly with him and initiates a lot of 
skinship which confuses him since he just witnessed her rejecting him in 
the present world. At the end of the MV when he follows her up to the same 
roof and he warps back into present world, he realizes that he shouldn't 
confess to her yet since she'll reject him. 
Hope that helps! I may have over explained >.< Also, turn on the subs and 
the story will have a better context. =) Ohh, and thanks for the interest 
in GOT7 via Jackson! You're pretty much sucked in at this point, it will 
only get worse. Good luck, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

top_comment.text:
i hope that people behind MAMA or the judges will read this.

MAMA stands for MNet ASIAN Music Awards, which for me represents ASIANS for 
AROUND THE WORLD.

So please take into consideration all the recognition and accomplishments 
of the the nominees around the globe not just in KOREA.

There will never be HALLYU WAVE if not for us, international fans.

I know that the voting is just a percentage and there are still categories 
to be considered.

I still believe the only GOT7 deserves the Best New Artist Award, since I 
have been a fan ever since and I watched them worked hard. I know that the 
other groups also worked hard, but GOT7 started from scratch since their 
debut. No reality show to back them up before their debut.

I maybe off point for some others point of view, but I'm a fan here, and 
realizing how a lot of GOT7 fans around the world are all trying hard to 
support them, and I just can't seem to take that it will all just be going 
to waste.

I still believe that GOT7 will prove them wrong, when the time comes. But I 
also believe that that time is now! 

GOT7 and IGot7 fighting!!!﻿

top_comment.text:
Seriously, I'm sad that ignorant people just use the word 'flop' for every 
boygroup they hate or don't like. I mean, excuuuse me, (diva tone lol) GOT7 
got over 12 million views just for their debut mv less in less than a year, 
their second MV got over 15 mil views in less than a year too and stop stop 
it mv got 1 mil views in a day which puts them at the same level with a few 
senior groups. And now they have over 7 mil views. (GOT7 lol, I just had to 
add that). Reminder: GOT7 also debuted in that same year their MVs got out. 
Even their dance practices has million views and those are like more views 
than some MVs other newbie groups have. Don't forget they're also a rookie, 
ladies & gentlemen. Some of their live performances even got 1 mil views. 
Not enough? Forget about views then.

Continuing on with awards. Every year we have loads of rookies and guess 
who got the rookie awards this year? GOT7. They got those awards along with 
Winner & RedVelvet. All representatives of the BIG3 companies. Yes, they 
might not have won any music shows yet but even RV from the biggest company 
didnt win yet. That doesn't make GOT7 a 'flop'. 

For those haters out there, you kept comparing GOT7 with Winner(who was 
already known before debut with their show) and EXO (who debuted few years 
before GOT7). I actually say that proves GOT7 isn't a flop cause think 
about it, would you compare someone who you consider a 'nobody' to people 
who are already popular? If GOT7 was really a 'flop', then why would you 
even bother bashing them and saying they are one? Cause if they are a 
'flop', you wouldn't have to waste your energy trying to argue with 
everyone about it. Why, you say? Cause you wouldn't even heard of GOT7 and 
there wouldnt be so much people defending them.

If they are a real flop, you would care less and wouldn't even know their 
name. You would be saying 'Who are they?' instead of actually arguing with 
their fans (yes, FANS. 'Flop' would mean they have none and you wouldnt be 
trying to defend your statement right now).

Visit Wiki and you would know GOT7 topped the charts with their albums even 
in Thailand & Japan. Their album even shot up to the number 1 spot on 
Billboard's World Albums chart and was number 2 on Gaon Album Chart.

Seriously, I didn't know 'flop' means being number 1 on charts. (In case 
you haters are still stupid, I was being sarcastic.)

Flop - Unsuccessful, fail totally. (Just making sure you haters were aware 
of its definition)

Wanna know if GOT7 is still a 'flop'? Visit the wikis for other rookie 
groups that debuted on the same year as them(if wiki has them) and compare 
their awards and nominations(if those groups have any). I dont want to 
mention names cause I might offend the fans of those groups but honestly, 
other groups can be considered a 'flop' if they were compared to GOT7. I 
even know a couple senior groups that would be the same.(Not gonna mention 
names).

Well, I will end my essay here. lol. See ya haters. If you want to try 
bashing me or prove me wrong, then go on ahead. I wouldn't care less cause 
everything I said was pure facts and information I got online and from my 
experience of being GOT7's fan. ^^ If I was rude, I apologize then. I was 
just trying to lay my opinion out there. ﻿

top_comment.text:
****** G O T 7 S L A Y ! ***********
"GOT7 is a flop?" This is the dumbest sentence i've ever seen in this 
thread. They performed here in our country with SISTAR and BERNARD PARK but *the 
event was dominated by GOT7 fans.* I was on the VVIP seat but I can barely 
hear them sing because fans keep screaming and cheering for them. The 
guards keep pushing the railings because fans went berserk during their 
performance and the hosts even told the fans to stay calm for us to enjoy 
the show. Some fans wore shirts with GOT7's logo. *GOT7 is very different* 
compared other groups (they really stand out) that's why I love them. They 
are only rookies but they already have huge fan bases overseas ! Although 
they have lower album sales compared to other groups, the number of sales 
is way higher than other groups to be considered flop and if they were 
flop, i'm sure they will be disbanded right away. *You HATERS better watch 
GOT7 grow and eat your words.* I'm sure that you will be absorbed in this 
fandom very soon. Please continue to keep an eye on them. Continue watching 
their MVs and their shows to gain viewers. Keep listening to their music 
until you will have a "last song syndrome" Spread the word to people that 
GOT7 exist not just an ordinary KPOP group but a *SPECTACULAR ROOKIE that 
shaken up your bias list !* *GOT7* GOT7 *GOT7* GOT7 *GOT7* GOT7 *GOT7* GOT7 
*GOT7* GOT7 *GOT7* GOT7 *GOT7* GOT7 *GOT7* keep reading this word until 
this word get stuck to your mind. *I am an AHGASE* (IGOT7) and I'm proud of 
it ! Nobody is perfect (even your idols are not perfect) and even though 
they have flaws or whatever hateful comments that you can think of whether 
its true or not *I STILL LOVE GOT7. I LOVE ALL OF THEM. I LOVE THEIR GOOD 
AND BAD SIDE because they are GOT7*. That's it. *G O T 7 slay !* I LOVE 
MARK, JAEBEOM, JACKSON, JINYOUNG, YOUNGJAE, BAMBAM and YUGYEOM why? because 
they are GOT7 !!! so simple yet meaningful - THEY ARE GOT7 ! *COME and GET 
it GOT7 !!!!!!!!!!!!!*﻿

comments.text:
+Veronica Sargent They're quite busy actually, Jackson is obviously the 
busiest but they've all been having schedules. They are currently doing an 
Asia showcase, they already went to Taipei and Shanghai, next is Hong Kong. 
I am not sure if they'll add more stops, it hasn't been announced yet. They 
also participate in the JYP Nation tour since last year. They of course did 
their Japanese tour/promotions, they went to Philippines for KCON. They 
attended most of the year end events, if you haven't seen their 
performances for those you should definitely watch them! Their remixes and 
dance breaks are awesome! They're filming for Idol Athletics next week, 
there's also rumors of them coming back to the Philippines twice in first 
half of 2015, and Bangkok and Vietnam. They'll be in Japan for some more 
stuff in June too. Right now there's no plans for a comeback, but we're 
speculating that they'll have at least 2 this year. And they'll prolly do a 
comeback for Japan too. Quite a lot of Koreans count in English rather than 
Korean. Mark and Jackson are fluent in English, BamBam knows English pretty 
well - he learned it from Markson, the others have basic understanding of 
English. I would say that Youngjae knows English a bit 'cause he was 
studying it, but we dare say that Yugyeom may be better than him now with 
his recent trip to America with Mark lol. Generally, you can count on 
anyone in JYP to have pretty good English skills. The variety show is 
called IGOT7, that one actually aired on tv in Korea. Real GOT7 was/is just 
an online thing for fans, JYP does them for 15& and 2PM as well. People 
don't put fake info in the wiki page, rather they just remove info is all. 
So what used to be pretty informative is now really bare. They used to have 
most of their show appearances on there, but now they only note Dream 
Knight - their mini web drama that just started Tuesday. Used to have like 
all their ages/birthdays too, now it's just names. I'm not really sure why 
people do that honestly, in December when a lot of the year end stuff was 
happening, their page literally got edited multiple times a day - I 
guesssss you can say it's kinda a good thing? Means there was a lot of 
interest in them.. But still annoying. It's slowed down a lot now, less 
frequent editing but still very bare.

I'm sorry guys, but I have to get this out of my chest. 
I love Got7 in general, but after their 3rd single, I still can't bring 
myself to like JB. Seriously, I did try but every time I see him during his 
solo shots, flashes of Rainbow's Seungah's face keep resurfacing. I still 
remember how much of a dickwad (sorry for the word) and how ungentlemanly 
he was towards the lady. They were on this show called "The Romantic and 
Idol" and god was he such an asshole (sorry again) back then for treating a 
girl like that. And now every time I see him, I just keep thinking about 
how he may be in front of girls and the girls he's going to meet in the 
future. Will he treat them the same way he treated her? Or will he be any 
different? I can't stop worrying. That's how much he left an impression on 
me and man is it bad. If you guys could just help me patch up his ruined

grateful.

GOT7 in peace, give the guy a chance. If you don't see another side to him, 
his real side, or who he has become, your opinions wont change, so you'll 
be stuck in this mindset. I'm very good at reading people and I watched all 
those shows and tbh he ended up being my bias. Not only because of his 
looks, but you could see how much he cares about the group and the members, 
and isn't super strict and rude as a leader, but rather knows when to have 
fun and when to be serious.
After you give him a chance, then reevaluate your feelings. Still don't 
like him? Well then, that's how it's gonna be. Just give him a chance yeah?

pictured might not be who he really is. Good Luck!!!

comments.text:
If there's someone who could ever understand JB, that should be me. Im a 
man too, and JB and I have a lot in common. I was hot-tempered and I could 
not show interest to someone I did not like. I was really a jerk too. 
Everytime I had a problem, I could not show my happy face to anyone. I was 
so immature, and I dont know why I was like that. Maybe because of how the 
way I grew up, and also because of my environment. But that was high school 
and college days. As we grow up, we become sensitive and learn a lot from 
our mistakes. We understood that this world needs love and gentlemen. Since 
GOT7 debut, I never see problems with JB's attitude. I know he was 
hot-tempered and easily to be irritated, as I have heard a lot of negative 
humors about him, but I think he is a grown-up now who knows how to be a 
human using all his experiences and lessons in life. He even does fan 
service now. At first he was awkward and asked the rest of GOT7 members why 
they do aegyo, that couple thing, and fan service. After their promotion 
with A, he started to meke fans happy with his actions. During a recent 
interview, the emcee commented if JB is really flirting now with fans, and 
the other GOT7 members agreed to the emcee. JB is a human now. He became 
matured, and happy now. Past is past. JB is my bias because I had the same 
lessons as him.
